title: Create consoul-tui package depending on SDK
description:
**As a** TUI user
**I want** consoul-tui package that depends on consoul-sdk
**So that** TUI can be installed with SDK as dependency

**Context:**
After consoul-sdk package exists (SOUL-260), create separate TUI package that depends on it. This completes the package separation, allowing users to choose CLI-only, TUI-only, or both.

**Package Contents:**
- consoul.tui (app, widgets, screens, themes, etc.)
- TUI-specific configuration
- CSS and styling

**Dependencies:**
- consoul-sdk (required, from PyPI)
- Textual (required for TUI)
- Click (required for TUI CLI integration)
- Pillow (optional for images)

**Technical Notes:**
- Create: packages/consoul-tui/pyproject.toml
- Create: packages/consoul-tui/src/consoul_tui/
- Move: TUI code from main project
- Depend: consoul-sdk package
- Update: TUI to use SDK services (from SOUL-249)
- Publish: To PyPI as consoul-tui
- Dependencies: SOUL-260 (SDK), SOUL-249 (TUI refactor)

**Acceptance Criteria:**

**Given** SDK package published (SOUL-260)
**When** I pip install consoul-tui
**Then** TUI and SDK are installed

**Given** TUI installed
**When** I run consoul (TUI command)
**Then** TUI works using SDK services

**Given** Full installation needed
**When** I pip install consoul-cli consoul-tui
**Then** Both CLI and TUI work with shared SDK

**Given** Main consoul package
**When** Installing pip install consoul
**Then** It's a meta-package depending on cli+tui (backward compat)

**Implementation Hints:**
- Depend on consoul-sdk>=1.0.0
- Keep Textual dependency
- Update TUI to import from consoul_sdk
- Ensure TUI uses services (SOUL-249 complete)
- Setup tui command entry point
- Test TUI independently
- Create meta-package consoul for backward compatibility
- Version independently
- Document TUI-only vs full installation

comments.author: jared@goatbytes.io
comments.content:
Closed as won't-do-now. Decision: Keep monorepo with optional extras instead of splitting packages.

Rationale:
- Development velocity more important than install size
- Simpler versioning and testing
- No evidence yet that server-only usage >> CLI/TUI
- Optional extras provide same benefit: pip install consoul[server]

See EPIC-014 description for full decision rationale and criteria for reconsidering.

Alternative approach implemented via:
- EPIC-016: Production SDK within monorepo
- EPIC-017: consoul.server module (not separate package)
- pyproject.toml optional extras for minimal installs
